story:
This campaign is reserved to Italian speakers only, but we are considering releasing an English version in the near future. You can contact us through our email address, kumi.masakoi@gmail.com

Primo progetto del team Ku•Koi, collaborazione tra KumiShire e Masakoi, "Fuoco Fatuo di Neve" sarà un connubio di fumetto e light novel, in un'alternanza di tavole e racconto illustrato. Un'avventura che inizierà con i primi due capitoli del primo atto a fumetti, "Primo inverno”.

Il volumetto verrà stampato in formato 16x24, Brossurato, 72 pagine a colori.

Yuki no Hitodama è un intreccio del destino che sembra fermare il tempo sulla pagina iniziale di una leggenda, riscritta e tracciata con il sangue nel cuore dell'inverno. Un progetto ambizioso che racconta il difficile cammino verso l’accettazione di sé, in un mondo avverso in cui l’innocenza dell’infanzia si sfilaccia nella guerra, nella solitudine, nel flebile limite tra vita e morte. Una storia di bambini costretti a diventare adulti troppo in fretta, crescendo in un mondo in bilico tra il dominio di lord crudeli e folli demoni sanguinari.

E mentre la differenza tra umani e demoni, tra bene e male, si confonde fino a diventare impercettibile, anche in un’epoca di contraddizioni e violenza può ancora sbocciare una bellezza magica e carica di fascino: come quella di un fuoco fatuo che brilla sul manto candido lasciato da una nevicata.

Immerso nei colori e nelle ombre soffuse di un Giappone feudale alternativo, con uno stile ispirato alle antiche stampe ukiyo-e di Epoca Edo (1600-1868) e con il tratto ruvido delle raffinate opere calligrafiche, “Fuoco Fatuo di Neve” affianca continue ricerche storiche alla propulsione creativa delle autrici, in un'unione esplosiva di tradizione e fantasy moderno.

 

LE AUTRICI

KUMI SHIRE si occupa della revisione storyboard, del disegno e della colorazione. Dopo aver frequentato la Scuola Internazionale di Comics di Firenze, ha iniziato a pubblicare nel febbraio 2016 il webcomic "Kitsune to Neko" (La Volpe e il Gatto), dopo il suo esordio di gennaio alla 24 ore comics, una maratona online di fumetti. Il suo stile unico e innovativo si ispira alle stampe della scuola Utagawa, con un tocco personale e inconfondibile che valorizza i colori.

MASAKOI MUSŌKA è ideatrice della trama e dei personaggi, si occupa della sceneggiatura e dei testi. Laureata in Lingua e Letteratura Giapponese, studia scrittura creativa e si è avvicinata al progetto “Yukidama” ispirandosi alle atmosfere surreali degli scritti di Izumi Kyōka e Akutagawa Ryuunosuke, narratori del fantastico e del grottesco a cavallo tra l’Epoca Meiji e l’Epoca Showa.

 

TRAMA 

 

In un'epoca di conflitti e ingiustizie, demoni e spiriti assetati di vendetta spiano la quotidianità dei vivi celandosi al buio dei vicoli e nel silenzio dei sentieri di montagna. Nella cittadina di Kanzawa, Akari, un giovane di stirpe samurai perfeziona la propria tecnica di tiro con l’arco al fianco dei tre fratelli, sotto la supervisione severa di un padre gravemente malato.

Kyōka, un ragazzino che preferisce la compagnia degli spiriti a quella dei suoi coetanei, attende l’inverno per poter rivedere la bellissima madre, dalla quale ha ereditato la passione per la musica ed un’insolita affinità per i climi più freddi. 

I due conducono vite agli antipodi, sfiorandosi senza incontrarsi – ma la prima nevicata dell’anno innescherà una serie di eventi inspiegabili che cambierà per sempre il loro mondo.

Dopo anni di duri allenamenti, Akari pensa che scendere in battaglia per il suo signore sia l’inevitabile coronamento di una vita passata in preparazione alla morte. Ciò che non immagina, o che rifiuta di ammettere, è quanta fragilità si nasconda dietro alla propria apparente sicurezza.

Catapultati in un'epoca di conflitti e ingiustizie, i due vedranno i loro destini intrecciarsi inevitabilmente, costretti ad affrontare le proprie paure, accettare responsabilità inattese e fronteggiare terribili forze sovrannaturali. Riusciranno a contrastare l’orda maligna che minaccia la loro terra, o cadranno vittima dei loro demoni interiori?

 

PERSONAGGI

 

Akari
明狩 - Caccia della luce

Età: 18 anni 

Terzogenito della famiglia Nishida, ha praticato un duro addestramento militare sin dall’infanzia, mostrando immediatamente una forte predisposizione al Kyūdō, l’arte del tiro con l’arco, sia da terra che a cavallo. Profondamente devoto alla sua famiglia, ha condotto una vita di esercizio costante e ubbidienza, maturando con il tempo la reputazione di guerriero promettente e responsabile. Ma dietro alla facciata di eccellenza impenetrabile e modestia, Akari cela debolezze che non è ancora riuscito ad affrontare. Estremamente timido e riservato, tende ad imbarazzarsi facilmente, soprattutto quando a stuzzicarlo è il fratello maggiore Ryuunosuke.

Ryuunosuke
竜之介 – Araldo del drago

Età: 26 anni

Molto legato al padre, con cui è cresciuto prima che si ammalasse, il primogenito della famiglia Nishida affronta la vita con positività, cercando di non perdere mai il sorriso. Riconoscendo la propria scarsa attitudine alla vita militare, Ryuunosuke preferisce onorare la propria famiglia tramite lo studio degli antichi testi, perseguendo una carriera da letterato: passa molto del proprio tempo libero a comporre poesie e leggere.  

Meiko
明子 – Fanciulla della luce

Età: 23 anni　

Energica e determinata, Mei ha praticato le arti marziali fino al momento in cui ha dovuto lasciare la casa del padre per sposarsi. Dopo la morte del marito, tuttavia, è ritornata dai Nishida e ha continuato ad esercitarsi con i fratelli: eccelle soprattutto nell’utilizzo della naginata, una lunga lancia dalla lama ricurva, e nel tiro con l’arco. Ferma nel mettere in pratica il proprio senso di giustizia, affianca alla propria forza di guerriera un lato dolce e premuroso. Assiste la madre nel prendersi cura del padre malato e dei fratelli, in particolare di Hikaru, che tratta come se fosse proprio figlio. 

Hikaru
光 – Luce

Età: 15 anni

D’indole impaziente e impulsiva, Hikaru vive la propria condizione di fratello minore con una forte voglia di mettersi alla prova ed esibire le proprie capacità. Cresciuto al fianco di Akari, che ha sempre considerato un modello, si allena nella scherma sin dall’infanzia, coltivando un talento fuori dal comune. Sa di essere abile e tende ad arrabbiarsi facilmente quando non riesce a dimostrarlo come vorrebbe – ma nonostante il suo carattere tempestoso e ancora infantile, è ben consapevole di amare i propri fratelli incondizionatamente.

Kyōka
境花 – Fiore del confine

Età: 13 anni

Figlio di un artigiano a Kanzawa, ha difficoltà a fare amicizia con i propri coetanei per via dei suoi particolari occhi viola e della sua costituzione fragile. Preferisce infatti giocare nella neve, mentre soffre di forte debolezza nei mesi più caldi. Non sembra tuttavia che la solitudine lo affligga: preferisce la compagnia di spiriti e strani animali che si manifestano solo in sua presenza, pur convivendo con la disapprovazione del cinico padre. Sogna di diventare un maestro musicista, ed ogni anno attende con impazienza di poter ritrovare la madre, con la quale passa i mesi invernali in un ambiente impregnato di musica.

Oyuki
お雪 – Neve

Misteriosa e bellissima, la madre di Kyōka veste abiti preziosi e vive in ritiro tra le montagne. La sua straordinaria abilità nel canto, e lo splendido suono del suo koto, un raffinato strumento a corde, sembrano rievocare gli antichi fasti delle corti del passato.

 

COME USEREMO I FONDI

Il primo volumetto di Yukidama includerà primi due capitoli sceneggiati da Masakoi e interamente disegnati e colorati da KumiShire. Mentre il primo capitolo è già pronto, il secondo sarà terminato entro la prima settimana di Novembre.

I fondi raccolti tramite questa campagna verranno usati interamente per coprire la stampa degli albi, la produzione dei gadget, la spedizione tramite corriere, la percentuale Indiegogo e le tasse.

GRAZIE!

Per averci dato fiducia, per aver letto o più semplicemente per essere passati di qui! Ogni condivisione di questa campagna Indiegogo può esserci davvero utile!

Potete seguire tutti gli aggiornamenti sulla pagina Facebook del team!
FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/kumi.masakoi
TUMBLR: https://kumimasakoi.tumblr.com/
story_txt: This campaign is reserved to Italian speakers only, but we are considering releasing an English version in the near future. You can contact us through our email address, kumi.masakoi@gmail.comPrimo progetto del team Ku•Koi, collaborazione tra KumiShire e Masakoi, "Fuoco Fatuo di Neve" sarà un connubio di fumetto e light novel, in un'alternanza di tavole e racconto illustrato. Un'avventura che inizierà con i primi due capitoli del primo atto a fumetti, "Primo inverno”.Il volumetto verrà stampato in formato 16x24, Brossurato, 72 pagine a colori.Yuki no Hitodama è un intreccio del destino che sembra fermare il tempo sulla pagina iniziale di una leggenda, riscritta e tracciata con il sangue nel cuore dell'inverno. Un progetto ambizioso che racconta il difficile cammino verso l’accettazione di sé, in un mondo avverso in cui l’innocenza dell’infanzia si sfilaccia nella guerra, nella solitudine, nel flebile limite tra vita e morte. Una storia di bambini costretti a diventare adulti troppo in fretta, crescendo in un mondo in bilico tra il dominio di lord crudeli e folli demoni sanguinari.E mentre la differenza tra umani e demoni, tra bene e male, si confonde fino a diventare impercettibile, anche in un’epoca di contraddizioni e violenza può ancora sbocciare una bellezza magica e carica di fascino: come quella di un fuoco fatuo che brilla sul manto candido lasciato da una nevicata.Immerso nei colori e nelle ombre soffuse di un Giappone feudale alternativo, con uno stile ispirato alle antiche stampe ukiyo-e di Epoca Edo (1600-1868) e con il tratto ruvido delle raffinate opere calligrafiche, “Fuoco Fatuo di Neve” affianca continue ricerche storiche alla propulsione creativa delle autrici, in un'unione esplosiva di tradizione e fantasy moderno. LE AUTRICIKUMI SHIRE si occupa della revisione storyboard, del disegno e della colorazione. Dopo aver frequentato la Scuola Internazionale di Comics di Firenze, ha iniziato a pubblicare nel febbraio 2016 il webcomic "Kitsune to Neko" (La Volpe e il Gatto), dopo il suo esordio di gennaio alla 24 ore comics, una maratona online di fumetti. Il suo stile unico e innovativo si ispira alle stampe della scuola Utagawa, con un tocco personale e inconfondibile che valorizza i colori.MASAKOI MUSŌKA è ideatrice della trama e dei personaggi, si occupa della sceneggiatura e dei testi. Laureata in Lingua e Letteratura Giapponese, studia scrittura creativa e si è avvicinata al progetto “Yukidama” ispirandosi alle atmosfere surreali degli scritti di Izumi Kyōka e Akutagawa Ryuunosuke, narratori del fantastico e del grottesco a cavallo tra l’Epoca Meiji e l’Epoca Showa. TRAMA  In un'epoca di conflitti e ingiustizie, demoni e spiriti assetati di vendetta spiano la quotidianità dei vivi celandosi al buio dei vicoli e nel silenzio dei sentieri di montagna. Nella cittadina di Kanzawa, Akari, un giovane di stirpe samurai perfeziona la propria tecnica di tiro con l’arco al fianco dei tre fratelli, sotto la supervisione severa di un padre gravemente malato.Kyōka, un ragazzino che preferisce la compagnia degli spiriti a quella dei suoi coetanei, attende l’inverno per poter rivedere la bellissima madre, dalla quale ha ereditato la passione per la musica ed un’insolita affinità per i climi più freddi. I due conducono vite agli antipodi, sfiorandosi senza incontrarsi – ma la prima nevicata dell’anno innescherà una serie di eventi inspiegabili che cambierà per sempre il loro mondo.Dopo anni di duri allenamenti, Akari pensa che scendere in battaglia per il suo signore sia l’inevitabile coronamento di una vita passata in preparazione alla morte. Ciò che non immagina, o che rifiuta di ammettere, è quanta fragilità si nasconda dietro alla propria apparente sicurezza.Catapultati in un'epoca di conflitti e ingiustizie, i due vedranno i loro destini intrecciarsi inevitabilmente, costretti ad affrontare le proprie paure, accettare responsabilità inattese e fronteggiare terribili forze sovrannaturali. Riusciranno a contrastare l’orda maligna che minaccia la loro terra, o cadranno vittima dei loro demoni interiori? PERSONAGGI Akari明狩 - Caccia della luceEtà: 18 anni Terzogenito della famiglia Nishida, ha praticato un duro addestramento militare sin dall’infanzia, mostrando immediatamente una forte predisposizione al Kyūdō, l’arte del tiro con l’arco, sia da terra che a cavallo. Profondamente devoto alla sua famiglia, ha condotto una vita di esercizio costante e ubbidienza, maturando con il tempo la reputazione di guerriero promettente e responsabile. Ma dietro alla facciata di eccellenza impenetrabile e modestia, Akari cela debolezze che non è ancora riuscito ad affrontare. Estremamente timido e riservato, tende ad imbarazzarsi facilmente, soprattutto quando a stuzzicarlo è il fratello maggiore Ryuunosuke.Ryuunosuke竜之介 – Araldo del dragoEtà: 26 anniMolto legato al padre, con cui è cresciuto prima che si ammalasse, il primogenito della famiglia Nishida affronta la vita con positività, cercando di non perdere mai il sorriso. Riconoscendo la propria scarsa attitudine alla vita militare, Ryuunosuke preferisce onorare la propria famiglia tramite lo studio degli antichi testi, perseguendo una carriera da letterato: passa molto del proprio tempo libero a comporre poesie e leggere.  Meiko明子 – Fanciulla della luceEtà: 23 anni　Energica e determinata, Mei ha praticato le arti marziali fino al momento in cui ha dovuto lasciare la casa del padre per sposarsi. Dopo la morte del marito, tuttavia, è ritornata dai Nishida e ha continuato ad esercitarsi con i fratelli: eccelle soprattutto nell’utilizzo della naginata, una lunga lancia dalla lama ricurva, e nel tiro con l’arco. Ferma nel mettere in pratica il proprio senso di giustizia, affianca alla propria forza di guerriera un lato dolce e premuroso. Assiste la madre nel prendersi cura del padre malato e dei fratelli, in particolare di Hikaru, che tratta come se fosse proprio figlio. Hikaru光 – LuceEtà: 15 anniD’indole impaziente e impulsiva, Hikaru vive la propria condizione di fratello minore con una forte voglia di mettersi alla prova ed esibire le proprie capacità. Cresciuto al fianco di Akari, che ha sempre considerato un modello, si allena nella scherma sin dall’infanzia, coltivando un talento fuori dal comune. Sa di essere abile e tende ad arrabbiarsi facilmente quando non riesce a dimostrarlo come vorrebbe – ma nonostante il suo carattere tempestoso e ancora infantile, è ben consapevole di amare i propri fratelli incondizionatamente.Kyōka境花 – Fiore del confineEtà: 13 anniFiglio di un artigiano a Kanzawa, ha difficoltà a fare amicizia con i propri coetanei per via dei suoi particolari occhi viola e della sua costituzione fragile. Preferisce infatti giocare nella neve, mentre soffre di forte debolezza nei mesi più caldi. Non sembra tuttavia che la solitudine lo affligga: preferisce la compagnia di spiriti e strani animali che si manifestano solo in sua presenza, pur convivendo con la disapprovazione del cinico padre. Sogna di diventare un maestro musicista, ed ogni anno attende con impazienza di poter ritrovare la madre, con la quale passa i mesi invernali in un ambiente impregnato di musica.Oyukiお雪 – NeveMisteriosa e bellissima, la madre di Kyōka veste abiti preziosi e vive in ritiro tra le montagne. La sua straordinaria abilità nel canto, e lo splendido suono del suo koto, un raffinato strumento a corde, sembrano rievocare gli antichi fasti delle corti del passato. COME USEREMO I FONDIIl primo volumetto di Yukidama includerà primi due capitoli sceneggiati da Masakoi e interamente disegnati e colorati da KumiShire. Mentre il primo capitolo è già pronto, il secondo sarà terminato entro la prima settimana di Novembre.I fondi raccolti tramite questa campagna verranno usati interamente per coprire la stampa degli albi, la produzione dei gadget, la spedizione tramite corriere, la percentuale Indiegogo e le tasse.GRAZIE!Per averci dato fiducia, per aver letto o più semplicemente per essere passati di qui! Ogni condivisione di questa campagna Indiegogo può esserci davvero utile!Potete seguire tutti gli aggiornamenti sulla pagina Facebook del team!FACEBOOK: https://www.facebook.com/kumi.masakoiTUMBLR: https://kumimasakoi.tumblr.com/

story:
Our campaign is now closed and fulfilling, but you can still shop Alterna at alternaaccess.com!

Many items shown here are not yet available on alternaaccess.com -- backers will receive those items first (comics & apparel) and once all perks have been shipped out, we will list those items on our site.  Thanks!

----------------------

EVERY PHYSICAL PERK BACKER GETS THE FOLLOWING BONUSES:

  • 11x17 fold-out poster (horizontal) SIGNED by publisher Peter Simeti
  • Single Issue TRADING CARD CHECKLIST
  • 1.25 INCH Alterna Comics PIN (CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE!)
  • 1 INCH Alterna Comics MAGNET (CAMPAIGN EXCLUSIVE!)
  • 2 INCH Alterna Comics STICKER
  • Blank Official SKETCH CARD

ADDITIONAL BONUSES FOR SELECT BACKERS:

  • BLANK FRONT POCKET SKETCH INSERT for all Collector Case backers
  • ALL COPIES of THE CHAIR #1 will be SIGNED by Peter Simeti (blank variant will not be signed)

 

PLUS! All 20 bonus issues have been unlocked in addition to the original 15 offered on this campaign.

  • The Actual Roger #1, 2, 3, 4
  • Baron Rat #1
  • Blood Realm #1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6
  • The Chair #1, 2
  • Exilium #1
  • Gods and Gears #1, 2
  • Legends of Log #1
  • Mighty Mascots #1, 2, 3
  • Mr. Crypt #1, 2 ,3
  • Mr. Crypt and Baron Rat #1, 2
  • Red Koi #1, 2
  • Tinseltown #1, 2, 3, 4
  • Trespasser #1
  • Void Walker #1
  • The XII #1, 4

These issues are available as add-ons and will be automatically included in the following bundles:

  • ($99) "Fully Loaded Collector Case" 
  • ($30) "Reprint Bundle"
  • ($250) "All Comics Bundle"
  • ($500) "All Ten Box Set + All Comics"

 

What's the BEST perk to get?

We absolutely recommend getting the FULLY LOADED COLLECTOR CASE -- it comes with:

  • Every unlocked single issue and blank variant
  • 18 front pocket collector case inserts
  • 36 side pocket collector case inserts
  • 1 collector case

All of the above for just $99.

(Add 3 more cases at checkout if you'd like everything to be shipped inside collector cases)

 

COLLECTOR CASES!

Customize your collector case with 18 front pocket inserts (7.5"x10.75"), 36 side pocket inserts (1.75"x10.75"), and if you get the "All Ten" bundle -- you'll get 10 exclusive inserts that form a connected Alterna Comics logo image. (Available as add-ons)

 

Looking to house your entire Alterna collection or the various perks featured on our campaign? Here's a short list of how many cases you'd need for each perk:

  • Reprint Bundle - 2 cases
  • Blank Variant Bundle - 2 cases
  • Fully Loaded Collector Case (comes with 1 case and includes the above 2 bundles) - 3 extra cases
  • First Issue Bundle - 1 case
  • All Comics Bundle - 10 cases
  • Every single issue published by Alterna - 15 cases

 

 

 

Blank Variants!

These Blank Variants will feature an uncoated cardstock cover that's perfect for drawing, inking, and coloring on. Feel free to make your own cover OR commission your favorite artist to draw something for you. The covers have empty bar code and corner boxes too, so you can fully customize your cover however you'd like.

*IT CAME OUT ON A WEDNESDAY #0 is a campaign-exclusive comic and will not be available for sale once the campaign ends.

Each blank variant issue is also available as an add-on!

 

Commissions!

OK so even though that's not the famous saying, the artists on this campaign all told me they'd rather receive money than "words".  Wild, right?

Want your commission in color? Send us a message after you purchase your art commission perk and when the campaign ends, we'll connect you with the artist of your choice so you can work out the details and the additional payment to add color to your commission.

 

Learn more about our comics!

 

Thanks For Your Support!

OK so even though that's not the famous saying, the artists on this campaign all told me they'd rather receive money than "words".  Wild, right?

story:
VIKING WOLF GETS UNLEASHED!

Viking Wolf Book I is a 40 page, 8.5 x 11 inch oversized prestige format book with squarebound spine written by Mark Poulton (Graveyard Shift, USAssassin) with art by Matt Dalton (Graveyard Shift: Ruiner) and Renzo Rodriguez (Impossible Stars) with colors by Dexter Weeks (Herald: Tesla & Lovecraft) and letters by Eric Weathers (Battle Brick Road)! 

Cover A by Matt Dalton and Sebastian Cheng

Rated Mature for gore, violence and sexuality. Created by Mark Poulton and Matt Dalton, Viking Wolf is a horror fantasy that at its heart is the story of a son's love for his father. Prince Gunnar Rovewulf defends the Moonshire with the help of the Blood Hammer, the most powerful weapon in the universe that just so happens to be powered by the blood of it's enemies. When his father is kidnapped by the evil Tollman, Prince Gunnar sets out to find him, but along the way unearths the truth behind the Blood Hammer and his father's dealings with the Tollman. His quest takes him to Earth, where he is bonded with an unsuspecting and unwilling human, Travis. Beautiful artwork by Dalton and Rodriguez highlight this tale written by Graveyard Shift creator, Mark Poulton. 

Cover B by Renzo Rodriguez and Dexter Weeks

BLACK & WHITE ARTIST EDITION AVAILABLE TOO! 

Black & White Artist Edition Cover by Jose Garcia

I've heard your requests and I am making a black and white version of the book available featuring a cover by Jose Garcia (Lumina Vhox)! This book will feature Matt Dalton and Renzo Rodriquez's art in their uncolored, pencil and inked form! A true must have for any art fan! 

FOIL COVER HAUNTED PIZZA YEARBOOK

My favorite era of comics' is the 90s' when so many new indies were popping up and making noise. I see a lot of similarities with today's crowdfunding scene! I loved when the different studios would offer yearbooks featuring never before seen art and introducing new characters along with bios of all of my favorite creators. In that spirit, I am offering the first Haunted Pizza Yearbook featuring art and bios from all the great talent (Matt Dalton, Renzo Rodriguez, Mike McMahon, Dexter Weeks and more) my son and I am working with on our creations including the first appearance of Gun Goth! These yearbooks will feature a foil cover! 

Haunted Pizza Yearbook cover by Renzo Rodriguez and Dexter Weeks.  

VIKING WOLF COLLECTOR'S CASE

The Viking Wolf Collector's Case will come with both covers to Book I, the Black & White Artist Edition, the Haunted Pizza Yearbook and a metal trading card. All books come signed by Mark Poulton and Matt Dalton. 

Viking Wolf Collector's Case art by Renzo Rodriguez and Dexter Weeks. 

FREE MORAL COMPASS MINI-FIGURE TO FIRST 100 BACKERS!

Everyone needs a little Moral Compass in their life and now the first 100 backers can have him! Courtesy of Firestar Toys and Haunted Pizza LLC it's the first The Moral Compass mini-figure! Not since Johnny Appleseed and Paul Bunyan has there been a more beloved American folk hero than The Moral Compass, Mark Poulton, the man who fulfilled five crowdfunded comic campaigns in a single year! 

100% COMPLETED! 

The art and colors for this project are 100% completed and currently being lettered. This book will go straight to the printer once the campaign ends. I know crowdfunding can provide many difficulties along the way, but I've managed to deliver on all of my campaigns. Here is a look at everything over the last 3 years that I have crowdfunded and fulfilled or will be fulfilling in the next 2 months. Rest assured your book will arrive! 

STRETCH GOALS!

With your help we'll add extra value to the campaign by unlocking stretch goals. Here are the first couple!

  • $5,000 - A foil trading card to all backers featuring art by A'ht N Stuff's Joe M Sonntag!
  • $10,000 - A 6x9 mini-print to all backers featuring art by Shadow Sentry's Eric Ninaltowski! 
  • $15,000 - A trading card of Viking Wolf's sidekick, Reef by USAssassin's Mike McMahon! 
  • $20,000 - A rolled 11x17 print of Gun Goth by Renzo Rodriguez and Dexter Weeks. 
  • $25,000 - Trading cards of The Tollman and Espiro for all backers. 
  • $30,000 - A Kenneth Rocafort print for all backers!

 

Thank you so much for making this the most exciting and rewarding time of my comic book career!

story:
Limited 6x9 Print, by Chaz Walgamott: (Only 350 available)

Behind DOWNCAST

Hello! I'm Clint Stoker. I have been writing fiction for years. Most notable was my novel ALL FOR OWEN. While I love writing novels, comics are my passion. I set aside writing novels to write comics. I honed my skills, and developed the craft of writing comics until it was time to team up with the right people to publish a professional-level comic.

DOWNCAST was a project that I had wanted to publish for years. I wrote a few versions of the script but it never quite felt ready. Until now. With the right script under my belt and with the help of a professional creative team, DOWNCAST is here, and better than I had ever imagined it could be

  • Story: Clint Stoker
  • Art: Ignacio Lazaro
  • Colors: Damian Penalba
  • Letters: Eric Weathers
  • Cover B Artist: Matthew Weldon
  • Cover B Colors: Derek Dow

Interior art - By Ignacio Lazaro:

What We Need & What You Get

We have everything we need to make DOWNCAST the best it can be, but we still need your help. It takes money to pay for professional art, get it printed and then shipped. We've run all the numbers and consulted experts - so here is the plan...

This funding is crucial to getting DOWNCAST completed and printed. I have been able to personally fund a portion of the project, but I need your help to bridge the gap. We need to raise a minimum of $7,000 to get this book made and into your hands. Without your contributions, we can't do this.

In return for your support, you get a piece of DOWNCAST history in the form of one of our perks.

Perks

Take a look at all of the great tiers available to your right. Select a copy of the book, or nab the original variant cover art. Pick a reward that suits you, and pledge your support, because without it, this cannot happen.

 

Early Development

 

 

Stretch Goals

(Unlocked) $7,000 - FUNDED!

(Unlocked) $8,000 - Additional 4 pages (52 pages total).

(Unlocked) $9,000 - Sketch and development pages in the back of the book.

(Unlocked) $10,000 - Stickers for everyone!

(Unlocked) $11,000 - Bookmarks for all $25 + backers.

(Unlocked) $12,000 - Matte Cover.

(Unlocked) $20,000 - Spot Gloss - UV cover.

(Unlocked) $25,000 - Foil Stamped Cover.

 

The Impact

DOWNCAST is only possible with your support. It takes a lot of time, talent, dedication and money to produce a quality comic. Thank you!

Risks & Challenges

Timelines can be a challenge. That is why we are giving ourselves plenty of time to get this project finished and into your hands. I was very conservative with the timeline. Other challenges can be with printing, shipping, and fulfillment. The good news is, I'm not alone. I'm part of a network of creators with successful campaigns who support each other. I view this project as a professional responsibility and I keep my commitments.

  • I am very transparent about the progress and process so you know exactly what is going on.
  • I'm a finisher.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Share this campaign on social media and suggest it to friends.

Thank you!
story_txt:
Limited 6x9 Print, by Chaz Walgamott: (Only 350 available)
Behind DOWNCAST
Hello! I'm Clint Stoker. I have been writing fiction for years. Most notable was my novel ALL FOR OWEN. While I love writing novels, comics are my passion. I set aside writing novels to write comics. I honed my skills, and developed the craft of writing comics until it was time to team up with the right people to publish a professional-level comic.
DOWNCAST was a project that I had wanted to publish for years. I wrote a few versions of the script but it never quite felt ready. Until now. With the right script under my belt and with the help of a professional creative team, DOWNCAST is here, and better than I had ever imagined it could be

Story: Clint Stoker
Art: Ignacio Lazaro
Colors: Damian Penalba
Letters: Eric Weathers
Cover B Artist: Matthew Weldon
Cover B Colors: Derek Dow


Interior art - By Ignacio Lazaro:







What We Need & What You Get
We have everything we need to make DOWNCAST the best it can be, but we still need your help. It takes money to pay for professional art, get it printed and then shipped. We've run all the numbers and consulted experts - so here is the plan...
This funding is crucial to getting DOWNCAST completed and printed. I have been able to personally fund a portion of the project, but I need your help to bridge the gap. We need to raise a minimum of $7,000 to get this book made and into your hands. Without your contributions, we can't do this.
In return for your support, you get a piece of DOWNCAST history in the form of one of our perks.
Perks
Take a look at all of the great tiers available to your right. Select a copy of the book, or nab the original variant cover art. Pick a reward that suits you, and pledge your support, because without it, this cannot happen.
 
Early Development
 


 
Stretch Goals
(Unlocked) $7,000 - FUNDED!
(Unlocked) $8,000 - Additional 4 pages (52 pages total).
(Unlocked) $9,000 - Sketch and development pages in the back of the book.
(Unlocked) $10,000 - Stickers for everyone!
(Unlocked) $11,000 - Bookmarks for all $25 + backers.
(Unlocked) $12,000 - Matte Cover.
(Unlocked) $20,000 - Spot Gloss - UV cover.
(Unlocked) $25,000 - Foil Stamped Cover.
 
The ImpactDOWNCAST is only possible with your support. It takes a lot of time, talent, dedication and money to produce a quality comic. Thank you!
Risks & Challenges
Timelines can be a challenge. That is why we are giving ourselves plenty of time to get this project finished and into your hands. I was very conservative with the timeline. Other challenges can be with printing, shipping, and fulfillment. The good news is, I'm not alone. I'm part of a network of creators with successful campaigns who support each other. I view this project as a professional responsibility and I keep my commitments.

I am very transparent about the progress and process so you know exactly what is going on.
I'm a finisher.

Share this campaign on social media and suggest it to friends.

story:
Voluntaryist Origins V

The Voluntaryist Origins V campaign continues the series in detailing how the protagonist, Jack Lloyd, and his new-found friend, Mack Lee, attempt to rescue Jack’s parents. What mysteries will Jack and Mack uncover in their fight to stop the total enslavement of humanity? Find out in Voluntaryist Origins V by getting a copy for yourself here on Indiegogo!

Comic Book Backstory

Voluntaryist is the tale of a superhuman hero who finds himself pitted against the government as the government tries to enslave humanity once and for all.  He is a young man with extraordinary powers created through a chance encounter with cosmic radiation. His personal mission is to rescue his parents from government agents, but that objective is often frustrated with the likes of giant monsters, super-villains, and even the armed forces.

The comic takes a contemporary look at the question, "What does it mean to be truly free?"

You can learn more about the comic series universe over at www.volcomic.com

---INTERIOR PAGES FROM THE LAST ISSUE---

---INTERIOR PAGES FROM THE LAST ISSUE---

Creator History

Voluntaryist was created by liberty fanatic and producer Jack L., whose passion for liberty is only matched by his passion for memes and film production. He began the long process of creating the series while trudging through his graduate studies.

The Voluntaryist comic series was in a prototyping process for 6 years and is now showcasing the canon origins story. The script for this issue has been written and the characters have been established through several future-verse comic issues available at www.volcomic.com

The comic series has seen exponential growth with over 100% funding on recent campaigns and is poised to grow bigger than ever!

The Goal for Origins V

20 new comic pages estimated for a 100% funded campaign.

We will produce as much of the comic as we can get funded for! The story is ongoing, so we will keep producing as much content as we can with this issue and then continue to move forward with future campaigns as we have done each year.

To get there, we need to raise $5,000 so this comic issue's potential is fully running.

The expenses are largely for the cost of hiring artists to produce the comic and the expenses associated with putting the comic into print format.

You can support us by making a secure contribution on the right-hand side by Credit Card/Debit Card.

You can redeem perks for your support such as:

$5 Early Digital Release

$15 Sticker

$25 Large Sticker

$35 Print

$45 Cosplay Cards

$60 Game Card

AND MUCH MORE!

Risks & Challenges

We are well-established in our development and are veteran Indiegogo users as this is our 11th COMIC CAMPAIGN on Indiegogo. So if you're looking to support a cool comic project that has a professional team with a proven track of success, look no further! We understand that there are a number of potential issues with shutdowns and shipments, but we are planning accordingly and want to assure you that we are using best practices to ensure we deliver by or before our estimated delivery dates.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you do not have pocket change to spare at the moment, you can help support the campaign by sharing the link to your social media, whether that's on Facebook, YouTube, Minds, MeWe, Steemit, Flote, or Reddit. We appreciate anything you can do to help us succeed!

story:
The figurines and FREE spaceship that came  with the campaign are/were exclusive to the Indiegogo Campaign.

If you would like to get your hands on the OVERSIZED 10 x 15 inch books...
head over to my place: http://www.theblackdiamondeffect.com/GPGstore/book11.html
 

WHAT ARE THE BOOKS ABOUT ?

Each book is 120 pages, OVERSIZED 10 x 15 inches, SoftCover, full color, solid story.
If you like SuperHeroes, Star Trek, Star Wars, Doctor Who, Hitch Hikers Guide to the Galaxy, Guardians of the Galaxy, Anime, Galaxina, Red Dwarf, Pizza... and multiple narratives which include visual easter eggs... These are the books for you.

SUMMARY:
Book 1: The only way for Joe and the crew of the Ladystar to stop a growing evil from taking over the universe, is to prevent the Dinosaurs from going extinct.

Book 2: Joe ordered a deluxe Pizza as the Earth is taken across the universe right in the path of a SuperNova! The crew of the Ladystar has 120 minutes to save the Earth before the pizza gets delivered!

story:
Overview

We brought you the Image TMNT conclusion (Vol. 3 #24, #25), "TMNT: Odyssey," and most recently "TMNT: Origin." Now we bring you "THE SHREDDER," part prequel to the Mirage TMNT and part sequel as well delivering on the promise of finally a "Round 3" between Oroku Saki and the TMNT.

Short Summary

From the same team that brought you the Image TMNT conclusion (Vol. 3 #24 & 25), "TMNT: Odyssey," and "TMNT: Origin" comes a brand new graphic novel. "THE SHREDDER" takes place (primarily) a few years after the conclusion of Mirage Vol. 4 and just a short time after "Origin," but also takes us back in time to reveal the earliest years of Oroku Saki.

  • My name is Andrew Modeen, a writer and filmmaker from the Seattle area. I’m a lifelong fan of the TMNT, and am also the guy responsible for the Image TMNT comic book conclusion that you can read about here: http://www.thegreenlanterncorps.com/tmnt/vol3.html
  • Also "TMNT: Odyssey," of which you can read a digital version here: http://www.thegreenlanterncorps.com/tmnt/odysse...
  • "TMNT: Origin" as well, the original version of which is viewable here: https://disk.yandex.com/i/hD5gEy8vOFaasQ
  • "THE SHREDDER" is a 95+ page graphic novel that revolves around the story of Oroku Saki, his beginnings, rise to power, ups and downs and even loves, and latest attempt at vengeance against his enemies.
  • The book is illustrated by Jim Lawson, veteran TMNT artist who has been drawing the TMNT since nearly the very beginning. Classics like “Sons of the Silent Age,” “Return to New York,” “City at War,” Tales of the TMNT Vol. 1, the entirety of TMNT Vol. 2 (Mirage), TMNT Vol. 4, and a great deal of Tales of the TMNT Vol. 2… this is the guy. Check out what he's been up to here: http://jimlawsonart.com
  • Andres Ponce, longtime TMNT artist ("Tales of the TMNT," Vol. 2 will contribute the cover artwork). Also he has agreed to contribute a 6 page backup story.
  • Two cover options will be available! Cover A by Andres Ponce and Cover B by Jim Lawson, inked by Keith Aiken ("City at War"). Both will be colored by Courtland Brugger.
      

  • Frank Fosco has done the back cover! Colored by Courtland Brugger.
  • Backup material from other talent to be announced!
  • An additional backup with Shadow will be included as well, featuring art by Arseniy Dubakov.
  • We have a variety of rewards in store for people able and willing to contribute to the project, as you will see below.

What We Need & What You Get

  • As with "Origin" and "Odyssey" in the past, Jim Lawson has very graciously attached himself to the project as our artist, however he does need compensation. 6 pages of “THE SHREDDER” have already been commissioned and completed in order to show you what is in store, but to complete the project additional funding is needed. Beyond this and the printing costs (which we know very well what to expect after "Origin," "Odyssey," and the Image conclusion) and the actual campaign fees to Indiegogo, we need to make sure every base is covered.
  • We are definitely not asking for money to profit in any way, shape, or form – we are only looking for funds to continue commissioning Jim Lawson for the pages that remain, then see things through on the production side. In addition to helping bring to fruition this project contributing is also a big way to give back to a man who has given a great deal to TMNT as we know it today. 
  • Funds received will be going to Jim Lawson first and foremost to get the remaining pages pencilled and inked, then to our colorist, and then to cover the final cost of the printing and distribution which we need to not lose sight of. Rich Horn, who was a huge asset during "Origin" and "Odyssey"'s distribution, has also graciously agreed to help in all matters of that to ensure speedy delivery of the final product.
  • The greatest care will be taken in the final shipping of the printed books. Rich Horn at tmnt-ninjaturtles.com has been been doing this a long time and sends books out with high quality packaging.

The Risk

  • In the event this campaign is unsuccessful to meet its goal, if at least 50% of goal is met then it will still be full-steam ahead. This is a passion project and it will be seen through, the same as "Origin," "Odyssey" and the Image TMNT finisher. Jim Lawson will continue to be commissioned, albeit at a slower pace. If less than 50% of the goal is reached, however, all funds will be returned. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Can’t contribute? You can help by getting the word out about our campaign, spreading the word about “THE SHREDDER” and this Indiegogo page to other Turtle fans.
  • Don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Downcast Volume 2: Wrize & Fall

A total 88-page premium quality perfect-bound graphic novel including:

  • 52-pages continuing the story of Joanne and Jax.
  • 26-pages of written story that delves into "The Classified History of Strata".
  • 10 pages of 'behind the scenes' extras.

After the near collapse of the city, Joanne and Jax find the opportunity they have been waiting for -- a witness willing to testify in court to save their father. They will have to act fast, because now the gravity-defying orb is working against them.

New to Downcast?

Be sure to back a perk that includes volume 1!

Joanne and her brother Jax are on the run from a corrupt government when the power to control gravity falls into their hands. With their father held captive and sentenced to death, can they use this legendary and incredibly powerful weapon to save him before it's too late?

 

 

Cover A - By Kelsey Shannon:

 

Cover B - By Matthew Weldon:

Downcast Returns

The creative team that brought you the hyper-successful original comic, Downcast, is back to continue the story.

In 2019, DOWNCAST raised over $31,000 on Indie GoGo and readers loved the story. So it's time to expand the story line and dig deeper into the history of the floating city that has so many readers invested.

Story: Clint Stoker

Art: Ignacio Lazaro

Colors: Damian Penalba

Letters: Eric Weathers

Cover B Artist: Matthew Weldon

What We Need & What You Get

It's simple:

  • With the profits from the first campaign, we were able to finance most of the creation of this book, but we need your help to pay for the lettering and printing costs.
  • We've expanded the book to 88 total pages! 52 pages to continue the story from Volume one, an additional 26-page illustrated docu-story called "The Classified History of Strata", and 10 pages of extras.
  • We need your help with the final financial push to make this book a reality.

 

The Secret History of Strata:

After publishing the first installment of DOWNCAST, readers were fascinated by the world, specifically, the city of Strata. So by popular demand, we are adding a written, documentary-style, story to the book. It will include a compilation of documents from the founding on Strata, first-hand experiences from historical figures, and some great illustrations. The more money we raise on this book, the more illustrations we will add to this section of the book.

Here is one great illustration from Matias Lazaro: 

 

Art by Peter Gilmore (Below)

 

Prints:

Large prints are 11x17" small prints are 6x9"
 

Art by Vinnie Tartamella

 

Stretch Goals:

UNLOCKED $15,000 - Every book gets spot UV gloss.

UNLOCKED $18,000 - Upgraded paper stock.

UNLOCKED $20,000 - Book marks for Everyone.

UNLOCKED $25,000 - More illustrations in "The Secret History of Strata."

UNLOCKED $30,000 - Everyone gets a trading card.

UNLOCKED$35,000 - Foil Stamped cover.

More to come

 

Risks & Challenges

Because this is my second crowd-funded graphic novel, I have learned how to mitigate the risks involved. Hitting the deadline is always a big priority, and can be challenging. The good news is, we delivered on the last campaign 2 months early.

I am dedicated to successfully completing this project. You have my word that you will get the perk you paid for.

Other Ways You Can Help

Talk about this campaign on social media. Share it with friends. Make videos. Every time you mention the campaign, it increases the chances of new backers discovering the book.

Thank you for your support!

Clint

story:
Mizuki Saga portrays the everyday life of Mizuki Wakahisa and friends in a cute comical way.  Mizuki is an energetic girl who has an overactive imagination who tends to blur the lines between fiction and reality as she tends to mimic scenes from games and anime. She usually tends to spend time with Reiko who she makes her cosplay and use her as a doll due to her height.

 

You can check out the Mizuki Saga Series here.
https://magientertainment.com/megami/chapter/mizuki-saga/

You can also follow us in Instagram and Twitter.

https://www.instagram.com/magientertainment/

https://twitter.com/Megami_Saga

 

Characters

The main character is a hype energetic ball of energy who loves manga, games and anime.  Her favorite thing to do is treat Reiko like a doll and make her cosplay.

Reiko is a Miko from the Sakura Shrine and is Mizuki's friend. She is also the reincarnation of the shrine's deity Sakura which alongside being small has giving her a inferiority complexity.

 

Mitsuko is Sakura's twin sister and the current head of the Sakura Shrine.  She is also one of the Holy Guard elders; however she’d rather slack off and have fun than do her duties. Her favorite thing to do is to create mischievous acts around the shrine to create chaos, especially to Sora.

 

Sora is a high ranking member of the Holy Guard and a friend of Reiko's deceased parents.  Due to Mitsuko's and the others careless actions he usually ends up having' to deal with extra paper work.

 

Content

The book will be bundled in a 5x7.5 book series called M3 which will include all of season 0 and 0.5 of Mizuki Saga in its full published resolution.  This will also include content not released yet and will include content from early January.  

The book will also include a mini adaptation of Black Clover's first episode with the Mizuki Saga characters portraying the characters. It'll be several pages long including a bonus omake after cast party. 

Bonus Content

Including Mizuki Saga we will like to announce that we'll be adding a new series to the book, Megami Saga Chronicles.

 

 

Megami Saga Chronicles is the main story line that revolves around the cast of Mizuki Saga. The story is about Mizuki's sidekick Reiko.  As the story unfolds  she begins her first mission as a Miko of the Sakura Shrine.  The book will include 1/2 of the first chapter as a pilot version of the series.  Depending on the performance and reception we will make it a full series in 2021.

 

 

Mizuki Saga Season 1 Promo Poster.

 

$1000: Exclusive Trading Cards for all physical tiers.

$2000:We'll add an exclusive Reiko Cosplay: Hatsune Miku Star Vocalist short to the book with an exclusive bonus for physical tiers.

$2500: Blue Clover Key Image poster image will be in production and available to pre-order.

$3500: ???????????  Will be announced once we cross $2500 

$4500: ???????????  Will be announced once we cross $3000 

$6000: ???????????  Will be announced once we cross $4000

 

Artist-Sentzukabe

I'm spanish, from the Basque Country state, I've worked as professional since 2016, Arts and Professional Comic and Illustration graduate, I've done several collaborative books from the galician market as well as for the newspaper as comic strip artist and now im doing my first solo manga aside my works for clients as manga artist and game graphics.

Scenario-Studio Mizuki

We’re an independent group that’s apart of Magi Entertainment that works on the Megami Saga series and assist with other tasks within the group.

Megami Saga Chronicles Artist- TBA

Artist will be announced shortly.

Why Back Mizuki Saga

 

  • The funds from the campaign will go directly towards the printing and rewards first, then production second.
  • The core artwork production has already been funded internally so the book pages are already in production and we're going for a flex funding this round. 
  • The funds will help us get the book and the series off the ground and allow us to eventually expand. 
  • We’ll be continuing to update free pages to the public every two weeks via our main website and other respective sites.
  • We are doing this to prove that we can release a quality product and release it in a timely manner.
  • Our goal is to release the physical releases quarterly or every two months, depending on how much support we get.
  • We’ll need your support to help get this series off the ground.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are able to contribute to our campaign, that is wonderful!  If you are not able to contribute by becoming a backer, you can still help by spreading the word about Mizuka Saga.  Please use the share links at the top of the page to help get the word out to others who may be interested in backing the campaign.  Thank you!
story_txt:
Mizuki Saga portrays the everyday life of Mizuki Wakahisa and friends in a cute comical way.  Mizuki is an energetic girl who has an overactive imagination who tends to blur the lines between fiction and reality as she tends to mimic scenes from games and anime. She usually tends to spend time with Reiko who she makes her cosplay and use her as a doll due to her height.



 
You can check out the Mizuki Saga Series here.https://magientertainment.com/megami/chapter/mizuki-saga/
You can also follow us in Instagram and Twitter.
https://www.instagram.com/magientertainment/
https://twitter.com/Megami_Saga
 
Characters

The main character is a hype energetic ball of energy who loves manga, games and anime.  Her favorite thing to do is treat Reiko like a doll and make her cosplay.

Reiko is a Miko from the Sakura Shrine and is Mizuki's friend. She is also the reincarnation of the shrine's deity Sakura which alongside being small has giving her a inferiority complexity.
 

Mitsuko is Sakura's twin sister and the current head of the Sakura Shrine.  She is also one of the Holy Guard elders; however she’d rather slack off and have fun than do her duties. Her favorite thing to do is to create mischievous acts around the shrine to create chaos, especially to Sora.
 

Sora is a high ranking member of the Holy Guard and a friend of Reiko's deceased parents.  Due to Mitsuko's and the others careless actions he usually ends up having' to deal with extra paper work.
 
Content
The book will be bundled in a 5x7.5 book series called M3 which will include all of season 0 and 0.5 of Mizuki Saga in its full published resolution.  This will also include content not released yet and will include content from early January.  

The book will also include a mini adaptation of Black Clover's first episode with the Mizuki Saga characters portraying the characters. It'll be several pages long including a bonus omake after cast party. 
Bonus Content



Including Mizuki Saga we will like to announce that we'll be adding a new series to the book, Megami Saga Chronicles.
 
 
Megami Saga Chronicles is the main story line that revolves around the cast of Mizuki Saga. The story is about Mizuki's sidekick Reiko.  As the story unfolds  she begins her first mission as a Miko of the Sakura Shrine.  The book will include 1/2 of the first chapter as a pilot version of the series.  Depending on the performance and reception we will make it a full series in 2021.

story:
Short Summary

 

As a fan of many Fantasy and Science Fiction works, Necromancer is world that scratches all those itches I enjoy in my entertainment: Tense thriller, enticing mystery, heart-pumping action, epic, heroic fantasy, and meticulously thought out societies and dogmas that flesh out this world. In this world the (Orthodox) Necromancer follows three simple precepts: Do not consort with the Dark Gods, the Undead are profane, and do as you wish, but pay the price.

 

In this 24 page story a Necromancer by the name of Gregor Mortem will navigate this treacherous world of dark magic and advanced technology as he goes up against rabid goblins and the profane undead. Gregor will question himself and his upbringing as he faces these daunting and dangerous trials while navigating sleazy mob bases, virtual-reality simulations, and desecrated graves.

 

Of course the perfect artist to illustrate this lurid tale as you will see below in the preview pages is senior Ibai Canales. His Basque's use of expressive faces, over the top violence, and love of Gothic architecture paint a beautiful picture on the world of Necromancer.

 

This comic will be the very first of many to come in the world of Necromancer, and if this campaign is successful then in the future you will be able to see the setting go from gritty cyberpunk noir to a High Fantasy, WW2-esque war epic as Gregor Mortem moves beyond the walls of District 13.

 

Cover A

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The funding goal is just enough to cover the printing and shipping costs of the book to backers.  I did meticulous research and arithmetic to make sure the goal would not be set too low to not be able to cover all expenses and taxes. The art has already been paid for and done as was intended so that I could make the price of the book as low as possible up front. Hopefully you will all be kind enough to get us above and beyond so that we may be able to hire a professional colorist, letterer, and maybe even make a  backup story to go along with the book.

The perks of this campaign are designed to give options to the backers whether you prefer reading digital (or live abroad), like holding a physical book in your hand, and for those who want to collect those special first edition copies.

 

The Impact

 

With the funding of this campaign I will not only be able to put the wild and crazy thoughts in my head into print, but you will be helping to build a Necromancer universe that will go on to tell many inspiring stories to come and maybe even branch out into other mediums. In the meantime without corporate backing or the infrastructure of an established comic company we need your help in order to print this baby and deliver it write to you (or email it if that's your thing).

 

Even though Ibai Canales has been behind other crowdfunding campaigns (including the six-figure hit Ironsights with Richard Meyer) this will be my first campaign myself so I will take full responsibility in bringing you a high-quality book in a professional and timely manner.

 

Risks & Challenges

If we unfortunately do not get funding we need then the book will not see print and you will be refunded for your contribution.

 

If the book does get funded and beyond then there may be mistakes made along the way as this is my first campaign.

 

Know that If we at least reach the base funding goal then you will be Guaranteed to receive the book no matter what it costs me.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Of course if you don't have the money at the moment you can help by sharing this project across the social media landscape whether its twitter, facebook, gab, minds, the chans, or you can even spam your friends discord channels.

 

Let your friends, co-workers, and families know as well so that they don't miss out on the opportunity to see this project come alive.

 

Don't forget you can also use the indiegogo sharing tools.

Follow the writer Jakob Morris on social media:

GAB:

https://gab.ai/ArtemisWyrm

 

TWITTER:

https://twitter.com/Artemis_Vale

 

YOUTUBE:

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCc1wasB8GN5ukP...

 

Follow the arist Ibai Canales on social media:

 

GAB:

http://gab.com/canalus

 

YOUTUBE:

http://www.youtube.com/user/Canalus/featured

 

FACEBOOK:

http://www.facebook.com/ibai.canales 

 

Those of you who are itching for Necromancer content right away can look up my very first Necromancer stories in prose in these short story anthologies on amazon:

 

Clarion Call vol 3, Necromancer For Hire:

https://www.amazon.com/Unbound-Clarion-Call-Boo...

 

Clarion Call vol 4, Necromancer: Deal With the Dark Gods

https://www.amazon.com/FairyTale-Riot-Clarion-C...

story:
HAIKYO CLOSES OVER $176,OOO.OO 

THANK YOU FOR AN AMAZING CAMPAIGN!

PLEASE CHECK OUT THE

SHI: OMNIBUS VOL. 1 INDIEGOGO HERE:

https://igg.me/at/SHIomniV1/x/20487910#/

Welcome to Crusade Comics’ SHI: HAIKYO 

After the terrifying events of SHI: Return of the Warrior, Ana Ishikawa must now save her teenage daughter Hotaru who’s been kidnapped by a murderous "Shi" copycat killer. 

But to do so, she’s forced to ally herself with her lifelong enemy, the manipulative Masahiro Arashi. What if it is all a ruse and Ana has fallen into a trap set by the Yakuza Oyabun?

Find out in SHI: Haikyo, the 64-page, full-color sequel to Return of the Warrior. This action-packed, psychological samurai thriller reunites Shi creator Billy Tucci and writer Steven Peros, with artist Gardenio Lima, colorist Brian Miller, letterer Mindy Lopkin and designer Nile Scala for a journey that takes the reader deep into the haunted ruins of New York’s Roosevelt Island as a mother must embrace death so that her daughter may live. And the best news is, ALL of Billy's Haikyo line art is complete and lettered. All we have to do is finalize the finishes, the coloring, and print it.

But we can only do that with your help.

We’ve got lots of special editions, challenge coins, prints, apparel, variant covers, (including the very first SHI COSPLAY PHOTO-COVER, featuring the cosplay superstar Joanie Brosas), sketch covers, remarks, commissions, and of course, original art!

And we're even making a choice few of YOU to become characters in the comic book!

Again, thank you for supporting Crusade Comics, me, and SHI for over 26 years.  I cannot wait for you all to read Haikyo and receive all the amazing STRETCH GOALS we have planned!

Please PLEDGE, please SHARE, and remember, Peace. Love. ShiStrong!

Billy Tucci

Backers Who Pledge For A Physical Perk Will Receive The Following STRETCH GOALS FREE*

(*Due to pre-ordering, some stretch goal packs may vary if ordered after March 1st)

NEW PERKS ADDED!

The Limited Shi: Haikyo: Rough Cut Edition and Art Print!

 

SHI: HAIKYO PREMIUM HARDCOVER EDITION COVER

 

THE FIRST EVER SHI GLOW-IN-THE DARK COVER EDITION!

 

"SAKURA MOON" INDIEGOGO EXCLUSIVE EDITION

 

CHAPMAN "GATECRASHER" EDITION COVER 

 

But Wait! There's MORE!

FIRST EVER SHI COSPLAY EDITION FEATURING SUPERSTAR JOANIE BROSAS!

 

SHI: HAIKYO ASHCAN EDITION!

 

MARIA LAURA SANAPO VARIANT COVER EDITION

CONNY VALENTINA WRAP-AROUND VARIANT COVER EDITION

ACTUAL METAL EDITIONS!

SHI: HAIKYO GOLDEN CHALLENGE COIN

 

 

PURE LINE EDITIONS

 

SKETCH EDITIONS PERSONALLY DRAWN BY BILLY TUCCI!

HAIKYO PRINTS!
